title: Interesting take on food delivery apps in the US.
selftext:
Just like the US,
Restaurants jack up prices on the apps to compensate for the enormous cuts that the apps take.
The delivery agents from Swiggy, Zomato, and the rest are independent agents working gigs for the company and don't recieve insurance or a steady pay, work through harsh weather conditions to make ends meet.

Now, John Oliver ends the segment by saying tip the workers, I disagree. I despise tipping culture and don't want to propogate the idea in India. However, I do tip only when the service has been exceptional. 

All that being said, there's a lot that has to change in this industry. I think I'm going to go to a restaurant and order take away if I can, I'm aware the promise of convenience has now become a crutch.
What are your thoughts?
